alert.note: Alert for Allamakee; Clayton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 09 at 5:26PM CST until January 10 at 6:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Heavy Snow Continues Across Southwest Wisconsin And Far Northeast Iowa... .Heavy snow continued to fall across the far northeast corner of Iowa and southwest Wisconsin at early evening. Another 1-2" of snow is expected in these areas through 8 pm with the snow then tapering off, exiting east before midnight. Meanwhile, strong northerly winds will gust from 30 to 40 mph mostly south of Interstate 90 this evening, decreasing overnight. Drifting snow will further hamper slippery to hazardous travel conditions. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow with additional accumulations of 1 to 2 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Iowa and central and southwest Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. In Iowa, visit 511ia.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
